alert.note: Alert for Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 4:22PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Hot Springs and central Washakie Counties through 445 PM MDT... At 421 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 18 miles southeast of Worland Municipal Airport, which is also 22 miles southeast of Worland, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Hot Springs and central Washakie Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin
